title: SB 1.18.6 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 28-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: The very day and moment the personality of Godhead Lord Sri Krishna left this earth, the personality of Kali who promotes all kinds of irreligious activities came into this world
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the 6th verse of the 18th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, discussing the entrance of Kali into the world upon Krishna's departure.

segments.key_quote: So this particular verse is very important to understand what is the way to counteract the irreligious influence of this age of Kali
segments.summary: The speaker explains the context of the verse, describing Parikshit Maharaj's encounter with Kali and the importance of understanding how to counteract Kali's influence.

segments.key_quote: Krishna is absolutely divine and is the creator of heaven and earth. Krishna is absolute. Absolute means there is no difference at all between the person Krishna and his name, his form, his qualities, his activities, his abode, his paraphernalia, his pure devotees. All are identical.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the absolute nature of Krishna, explaining that there is no difference between Krishna and His name, form, qualities, etc., and that Krishna is fully present in the sound vibration of His name.

segments.key_quote: In those two syllables Krishna is fully present with all his, Krishna means Krishna with all his potencies... Krishna is fully present in his name he is fully present in the form the form of the deity in the temple Krishna is fully present Krishna is fully present in his descriptions given in the Bhagavatam
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Krishna's presence in His name, form (deity), and descriptions in the Bhagavatam, emphasizing that Krishna is fully present with all His potencies.

segments.key_quote: Deepak Sharma the person and his name Deepak Sharma the two are completely different... the substance water and the name water... the word water is different from the substance water I have to actually drink water only then my thirst will be quenched
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the material and spiritual realms, using the analogy of a person's name and the substance of water to illustrate the difference between material and transcendental realities.

segments.key_quote: You say Krishna you directly contact the supreme person Krishna in full Krishna is fully present... Krishna is present in the form of the deity because he's all-powerful he agrees to enter into the deity form... Krishna is present in his transcendental form with all his transcendental potencies Krishna is fully present
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that chanting Krishna's name directly connects one with Krishna, and that Krishna is present in the deity form due to His all-powerful nature.

segments.key_quote: Kali cannot enter our life. Kali cannot enter the jurisdiction of the place where such chanting goes on... That is the technique of driving away the personality of Kali from the world... So many ways one can remain immune to the influence of Kali.
segments.summary: The speaker explains that Kali cannot influence those who constantly chant Hare Krishna, worship Krishna, and engage in devotional service, providing a practical method for protection from Kali's influence.

segments.key_quote: If the state arranges to distribute transcendental sound by resounding the holy name, fame and activities of the Lord... then a favorable condition will be created... But we can drive away this evil influence by broadcasting the holy name of the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses how modern technology like radio and television can be used to broadcast the holy name of Krishna and counteract the evil influence of Kali, suggesting a practical application of devotional principles in the modern world.

segments.key_quote: I will stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes the lecture with gratitude and the Hare Krishna mantra.
